metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9146 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description: The TNEFFillMapi function in lib/ytnef.c in libytnef in ytnef through 1.9.2 does not ensure a nonzero count value before a certain memory allocation, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted tnef file.

criterions.comment: libytnef: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
